content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    julia_blocks = [findnext(r"^```julia\n", lines, m.start) for m in eachmatch(r"^```julia\n", lines)]
    # handle the case where there are no julia code blocks
    if isempty(julia_blocks)
        return ""
    end
    
    # extract all the code blocks and join them together with a newline
    codes = map(start -> replace(lines[start + 2:findnext(r"^```\n", lines, start) - 1], r"^```julia\n|\n```\n$" => ""), julia_blocks)
    return join(codes, "\n")
end
```

This function assumes that the markdown document is valid and that each Julia code block is preceded by a line starting with ````julia` and followed by a line starting with `````. If there are multiple Julia code blocks in the document, it will extract them all and return them as a single string with each code block separated by a newline character.
